isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Orifice Tube System, Pre-March 2007 - 3200, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500, 8600 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - A/C REFRIGERANT LINE (CONDENSER-TO-EVAPORATOR)

note.para: Refer to Figure 25 while performing the following Remove and Install procedures.

step1.para: Discharge the A/C system. Refer to DISCHARGING THE SYSTEM .

Depending on the model, it may be necessary to remove nearby assemblies (right splash panel, fixed grille, or recirculation shield) to gain access to the fittings, or to remove the A/C lines. Refer to HOOD, GRILLE, and FENDERS section in GROUP 09- FRONT END SHEET METAL in the Master Service Manual.
If necessary (for access to A/C line), disconnect clips securing transmission oil cooler lines to radiator frame.
Disconnect wiring connector to pressure transducer (3).

figure.caption: Figure 25. A/C Refrigerant Line (Condenser-to-Evaporator) (Shown with Recirculation Shield and Splash Panel Removed)

step1.para: Unclip clamp (4) securing condenser-to-evaporator line to frame rail.
Unclip clamp (7) securing line to evaporator housing (8).
Unclip hose support clamps (2) securing A/C lines to radiator frame.
Disconnect condenser-to-evaporator line (5) fitting from condenser (1) outlet fitting.
Disconnect condenser-to-evaporator line (5) from fitting on orifice A/C line (6).
Remove condenser-to-evaporator line (5).
Remove pressure transducer (3) from condenser-to-evaporator line.
Transfer pressure transducer (3), and any attached clamps, from removed condenser-to-evaporator line; or install new pressure transducer in new line.

If the system is to be flushed or purged, perform that operation before reassembling the system. Refer to PURGING OR FLUSHING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM
.
Place condenser-to-evaporator line (5) in approximate location.

note.para: Always lubricate O-rings with mineral-based oil during installation.

step1.para: Using a new O-ring and C-plate connect condenser-to-evaporator line to fitting on A/C orifice line (6). Tighten to 20,000 ±1000 N.mm (180 ±10 lbf-in).
Using a new O-ring and C-plate connect condenser-to-evaporator line fitting to condenser (1) outlet fitting. Tighten to 20,000 ±1000 N.mm (180 ±10 lbf-in).
Using clamp (4) secure line to frame rail.
Using clamp (7) secure line to evaporator housing (8).
Using support clamp (2) secure A/C lines to radiator frame.
Connect wiring connector to pressure transducer (3).
If previously moved, use clips to secure transmission oil cooler lines to radiator frame.

Install any assemblies that were removed to gain access to the compressor-to-condenser line (such as right splash panel, fixed grille, or recirculation shield). Refer to HOOD, GRILLE, and FENDERS section in GROUP 09- FRONT END SHEET METAL in the Master Service Manual.
